bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 172 (Wednesday, October 30, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. VEASEY:H.R. 4933.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Sec. 8.[Page H8679]

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H8789)
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

summary.text:
Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Amendment Act

This bill expands the technical assistance provided by community-based organizations under the Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Act to certain employers and labor organizations to include reimbursement for childcare and transportation expenses incurred by participants in apprenticeship programs.

It also modifies selection criteria for grantees to require the Department of Labor to select not fewer than one employer or labor union from each state to receive technical assistance.

bill.title: Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Amendment Act

item.title: Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Amendment Act

To amend the Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Act to provide for reimbursement of certain expenses and to establish new requirements for selection of grantees, and for other purposes.
Women in Apprenticeship and Nontraditional Occupations Amendment Act

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H8789)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
